thread.title: TV highlights: Comedian Jim Gaffigan stars in a new TV Land sitcom inspired by his real life.
thread.title_full: TV highlights: Comedian Jim Gaffigan stars in a new TV Land sitcom inspired by his real life. - The Washington Post

author: By — Lauren McEwen
title: TV highlights: Comedian Jim Gaffigan stars in a new TV Land sitcom inspired by his real life.
text:
From left: Daniel (Michael Ian Black), Jim (Jim Gaffigan), Jeannie (Ashley Williams) and Dave (Adam Goldberg) in “The Jim Gaffigan Show.” (Courtesy of TV Land) By — Lauren McEwen July 14 at 6:12 PM (All times Eastern)
Hosted by “Talk Soup’s” Joel McHale, the 23rd annual “ESPY Awards” (ABC at 8 p.m.) honors several prominent teams and athletes, including Caitlyn Jenner, former Notre Dame basketball player and Iraq veteran Danielle Green, and Cincinnati Bengals tackle Devon Still, who will accept in behalf of his daughter, Leah, 5, whose cancer is in remission.
The “America’s Got Talent” (NBC at 8) judges review the acts they liked best during auditions.
On the next “Operation Wild” (PBS at 8), veterinarians perform groundbreaking procedures on several ailing animals, including a dolphin without a tail and a bear in need of brain surgery.
FINALE WATCH: “Bullseye” (Fox at 9) contestants compete in challenges called Zip Timeline, Center Spin and Truck-to-Truck.
“NOVA” (PBS at 9) is a special on Pluto featuring the first detailed images from the New Horizons probe.
The next “Food Paradise International” (Travel at 9) highlights deep-fried foods from around the world, including bacon-wrapped, beer-battered jalapeño popper with cheese from South Africa.
On the next “Suits” (USA at 9), Zane and Mike butt heads while working together on a class-action case, Harvey goes to great lengths to help an important client and Donna gives Louis some advice on ending a feud.
RETURNING SHOW: Mark gets a visit from Paul’s family in the fourth season opener of “Wahlburgers” (A&E at 9:30).
On the next “Extant” (CBS at 10), Molly finally finds out what happened to her son, and Julie faces some troubling consequences after choosing to wipe Ethan’s memory.
SERIES PREMIERE: On “The Jim Gaffigan Show” (TV Land at 10), t comedian tries to balance his love of food, fatherhood and stand-up comedy in the sitcom.
SERIES PREMIERE: “All That Jazz” (TLC at 10) is a docuseries that follows the life of a 14-year-old transgender girl from Florida as she heads to high school.
The next episode of “Catfish: The TV Show” (MTV at 10) focuses on a woman whose name and photos were used to create a fake profile years ago.
Elliot’s personal issues jeopardize an “fsociety” mission on the next “Mr. Robot” (USA at 10).
SERIES PREMIERE: In the series “Impastor” (TV Land at 10:30), a gambler named Buddy Dobbs poses as the gay pastor of a small town church to evade a loan shark.
SERIES PREMIERE: Brothers (and 98 Degrees bandmates) Drew and Nick Lachey open a Cincinnati sports bar and restaurant in the reality series, “Lachey’s Bar” (A&E at 10:30).
Amy Schumer and Ian McKellan stop by for an episode of “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” (NBC at 11:34), featuring musical guest Alan Jackson.
— Lauren McEwen
